sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Interstate Compact on Placement of Children Act.

sections.heading: The Interstate Compact on the Placement of Children is hereby enacted
sections.text:
into law and entered into with all other jurisdictions legally joining
therein in form substantially as follows:INTERSTATE COMPACT ON THE PLACEMENTOF CHILDRENARTICLE I. Purpose and Policy

sections.heading: Financial responsibility for any child placed pursuant to the provisions
sections.text:
of the Interstate Compact on the Placement of Children shall be determined
in accordance with the provisions of Article V thereof in the first
instance. However, in the event of partial or complete default of
performance thereunder, the provisions of the Revised Uniform Reciprocal
Enforcement of Support Act, approved August 28, 1969, as amended, also may
be invoked.

sections.heading: The "appropriate public authorities" as used in Article III of the
sections.text:
Interstate Compact on the Placement of Children shall, with reference to
this state, mean the Department of Children and Family Services, and the
Department shall receive and act with reference to notices required by
Article III.

sections.heading: As used in paragraph (a) of Article V of the Interstate Compact on the
sections.text:
Placement of Children, the phrase "Appropriate authority in the receiving
state" with reference to this state means the Department of Children and
Family Services.

sections.heading: The
sections.text:
officers and agencies of this State and its subdivisions having
authority to place children are empowered to enter into agreements with
appropriate officers or agencies of or in other party states pursuant to
paragraph (b) of Article V of the Interstate Compact on the Placement of
Children. Any such agreement which contains a financial commitment or
imposes a financial obligation on a subdivision
of this State shall not be binding unless it has the approval in writing
of the chief local fiscal
officer of the subdivision.

sections.heading: Any requirements for visitation, inspection or supervision of children,
sections.text:
homes, institutions or other agencies in another party state which may
apply under the Interstate Compact on Juveniles or any other Act or
regulation shall be deemed to be met if performed pursuant to an agreement
entered into by appropriate officers or agencies of this state or a
subdivision thereof as contemplated by paragraph (b) of Article V of the
Interstate Compact on the Placement of Children.

sections.heading: No Act or regulation restricting out of state placement shall apply to
sections.text:
placements made pursuant to the Interstate Compact on the Placement of
Children.

sections.heading: Any court having jurisdiction to place delinquent children may place
sections.text:
such a child in an institution in another state pursuant to Article VI of
the Interstate Compact on the Placement of Children and shall retain
jurisdiction as provided in Article V thereof.

sections.heading: As used in Article VII of the Interstate Compact on the Placement of
sections.text:
Children, the term "executive head" means the Governor. The Governor is
authorized to appoint a compact administrator in accordance with the terms
of said Article VII.
